Description: THIS GRANT PROPOSAL CONTINUES THE EFFECTIVE PROGRAM BEGUN IN 1999 BY THE MAINE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION.OVERALL OBJECTIVES   SCHEDULETHE PUMPOUT GRANT PROGRAM IS IN THE FINAL PHASE OF NEW STATION INSTALLATION BASED ON THE REVISED MAINE BOAT SEWAGE MANAGEMENT PLAN.  THE REMAINING PUMPOUT LOCATIONS IDENTIFIED IN THE PLAN ARE QUITE REMOTE AND HAVE PROVEN DIFFICULT TO ADDRESS AND THUS REACH THE GOAL OF A PUMPOUT WITHIN 4 MILES OF THE 100 MOST SIGNIFICANT HARBORS IN MAINE.  WE HOPE THAT WITH A VARIETY OF SYSTEM OPTIONS AND PRECEDENTS SET BY OTHER TOWNS, WE WILL FINALLY BE SUCCESSFUL IN ADDRESSING THE LAST SERVICE GAPS.  ALSO, WITH THIS GRANT WE HOPE TO IMPROVE THE EASE OF PUMPOUT SERVICE TO A VARIETY OF VESSELS BY THE ADDITION OF A NUMBER OF SELF-SERVE PUMPOUT FLOATS IN MORE REMOTE ANCHORAGES, AND SYSTEMS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LARGER VESSELS.  WE WILL CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT THE EDUCATION   OUTREACH (E O) PLAN  AND SUPPORT THE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF ESTABLISHED PUMPOUT STATIONS THROUGH THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE GRANTS.  AS PART OF THE STATE MATCH TO THE FEDERAL GRANT, WE WILL CONTINUE THE INSPECTION PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT ALL PUMPOUTS ARE WORKING AND IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAW AND GRANT CONDITIONS.  THE SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES AND SCHEDULE ARE DETAILED BELOW.  BY JUNE 15, 2023 PROVIDE GRANTS FOR THE INSTALLATION OR REPLACEMENT OF 8 PUMPOUT STATIONSBY JUNE 15, 2023, PROVIDE GRANTS FOR THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING PUMPOUT STATIONS AND BOATSCONDUCT ONE INSPECTION PER SEASON AT EACH OF THE PUMPOUT STATIONSBY FEBRUARY 15, 2023, REVIEW E O PLAN AND REWORK AS APPROPRIATE

MARYLAND HAS SUCCESSFULLY UTILIZED CLEAN VESSEL ACT (CVA) FUNDS SINCE 1992 TO HELP MARINAS INSTALL OVER 350 PUMPOUTS. THERE IS STILL ROOM TO ADD NEW PUMPOUTS, AND MANY ARE NOW WELL PAST THEIR USEFUL LIFE OF 10 YEARS. RECREATIONAL BOATING ACTIVITY IS A MAINSTAY OUTDOOR RECREATION ACTIVITY IN MARYLAND AND BOATERS RELY ON PUMPOUT STATIONS ACROSS THE STATE FROM OUR POPULAR LAKES IN THE WESTERN REGION, THE MANY TRIBUTARIES OF CHESAPEAKE BAY, AND THE COASTAL BAYS IN THE EAST. MARYLAND HAS UNDERTAKEN A MULTI-YEAR EFFORT TO INSPECT ALL GRANT FUNDED PUMPOUTS TO DETERMINE IF THEY ARE OPERABLE OR IF THEY NEED TO BE REPLACED OR UPGRADED.MARYLAND ALSO HAS CONTRACTORS THAT OPERATE THREE POPULAR PUMPOUT VESSELS IN BUSY HARBORS OR ANCHORAGES.MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR) HAS ALSO INITIATED OUTREACH EFFORTS FOR BOATERS AND MARINA OPERATORS ON HOW TO HANDLE THE DISPOSAL OF VESSEL GENERATED SEWAGE. MARINAS AND BOATERS IN MARYLAND NEED UP-TO-DATE AND ACCURATE PUMPOUT INFORMATION.

THE FUNDS OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE NECESSARY TO PROVIDE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE REIMBURSEMENT TO STATIONARY FACILITIES AND INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THE INLAND REGULATIONS REGARDING SEWAGE DISCHARGE THROUGH AN OUTREACH PROGRAM. WITHOUT THIS FUNDING, POLLUTION FROM BOAT DISCHARGE MAY CAUSE CONTAMINATION OF PUBLIC WATER SUPPLIES, CAUSE RESTRICTED OR REDUCED FISHING OPPORTUNITIES, BEACH ADVISORIES, ANOXIC ZONES, AND WATER QUALITY DEGRADATION.NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) PROPOSES TO: PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO 3 STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES FOR THE 2023 BOATING SEASON. FUND A PORTION OF SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR 1 STAFF PERSON TO MAINTAIN CURRENT RESOURCE MATERIALS, OVERSEE SUB-GRANTS FOR PUMPOUT SERVICES, PREPARE THE NECESSARY FEDERAL REPORTS, AND CONTINUE PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS. PROVIDE FUNDS FOR CVA SIGNS, PUBLICATIONS, AND OTHER OUTREACH MATERIALS AS NEEDED.NHDES EXPECTS THAT BY PROVIDING THIS PROGRAM AS PROPOSED ABOVE WILL KEEP STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN GOOD WORKING ORDER THEREBY INCREASING PUBLIC ACCESSIBILITY TO PUMPOUTS, ENHANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF WASTEWATER POLLUTION ISSUES AND DISPOSAL OPTIONS, HELP TO PREVENT BEACH ADVISORIES DUE TO OVERBOARD DISCHARGE, AND HELP TO PROTECT OVERALL WATER QUALITY.THIS PROJECT SCOPE IS LIMITED TO THE INLAND WATERS OF NEW HAMPSHIRE WHICH ARE PRIMARILY FOCUSED ON NEW HAMPSHIRES LARGEST INLAND LAKES WHERE BOATS WITH ONBOARD HEADS ARE COMMON. MOST PROJECT ACTIVITIES ARE FOCUSED ON POPULAR AREAS FOR BOATING ACTIVITY, ESPECIALLY BOATING CLUBS AND MARINAS. THERE ARE TWELVE PUBLIC AND FOUR PRIVATE STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE INLAND WATERS. THE NH CVA PROGRAM OFFERS OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE GRANTS TO ALL THE STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES, IN ADDITION TO REPAIR REPLACEMENT GRANTS, AS NEEDED. APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE ACCEPTED YEAR-ROUND AND APPROVED ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVED BASIS GIVEN THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE CVA GRANT FUNDING.

THE FUNDS OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE NECESSARY TO OPERATE MOBILE PUMPOUT BOAT SERVICE, PROVIDE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE REIMBURSEMENT TO STATIONARY FACILITIES, AND INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THE COASTAL REGULATIONS REGARDING SEWAGE DISCHARGE THROUGH AN OUTREACH PROGRAM. WITHOUT THIS FUNDING, POLLUTION FROM BOAT DISCHARGE MAY CAUSE SHELLFISH CLOSURES, RESTRICTED OR REDUCED FISHING OPPORTUNITIES, BEACH ADVISORIES, ANOXIC ZONES, AND WATER QUALITY DEGRADATION.NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) PROPOSES TO: PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO 1 STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITY FOR THE 2023 BOATING SEASON. PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO SUPPORT 1 MOBILE PUMPOUT BOAT FOR THE 2023 BOATING SEASON. FUND A PORTION OF SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR 1 STAFF PERSON TO MAINTAIN CURRENT RESOURCE MATERIALS, OVERSEE SUB-GRANTS FOR PUMPOUT SERVICES, PREPARE THE NECESSARY FEDERAL REPORTS, AND CONTINUE PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS. PROVIDE FUNDS FOR CVA SIGNS, PUBLICATIONS, AND OTHER OUTREACH MATERIALS AS NEEDED.NHDES EXPECTS THAT BY PROVIDING THIS PROGRAM AS PROPOSED ABOVE WILL KEEP STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN GOOD WORKING ORDER, INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESSIBILITY TO PUMPOUTS THROUGH THE MOBILE SERVICE, ENHANCE PUBLIC AWARENESS OF WASTEWATER POLLUTION ISSUES AND DISPOSAL OPTIONS, HELP TO PREVENT BEACH ADVISORIES AND SHELLFISH CLOSURES DUE TO OVERBOARD DISCHARGE, AND HELP TO PROTECT OVERALL WATER QUALITY.THIS PROJECT SCOPE IS LIMITED TO THE COASTAL WATERS OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, WHICH INCLUDE TIDAL WATERS, ESTUARIES, AND OPEN OCEAN OUT TO THREE NAUTICAL MILES FROM SHORE. MOST PROJECT ACTIVITIES ARE FOCUSED ON POPULAR AREAS FOR BOATING ACTIVITY, ESPECIALLY BOATING CLUBS AND MARINAS. THE MOBILE PUMPOUT VESSEL TRAVELS MOST OFTEN IN THE PISCATAQUA RIVER GREAT BAY AND HAMPTON HARBOR WHERE THEY PUMP SEWAGE FROM BOATS PRIMARILY AT DOCKS AND MOORINGS. THERE ARE THREE PUBLIC STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN NEW HAMPSHIRE IN COASTAL WATERS. THE NH CVA PROGRAM OFFERS OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE GRANTS TO ALL THE STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES, IN ADDITION TO REPAIR REPLACEMENT GRANTS, AS NEEDED. APPLICATIONS FOR GRANTS ARE ACCEPTED YEAR-ROUND AND APPROVED ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVED BASIS GIVEN THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE CVA GRANT FUNDING.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO HELP FUND BOATING IMPROVEMENTS AND MAINTENANCE OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES AT APACHE LAKE, CANYON LAKE, ROOSEVELT LAKE AND LAKE MEAD. ADDITIONALLY, THE AWARD WILL PROVIDE A WAVE ATTENUATOR AT APACHE LAKE TO PROTECT CLEAN VESSEL INFRASTRUCTURE IN THE MARINA. IT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING FOR A PUMPOUT BOAT AT APACHE LAKE. TEMPLE BAR MARINA AT LAKE MEAD WILL REPLACE A MOTOR ON ITS PUMPOUT BARGE. TEMPLE BAR WILL ALSO PURCHASE A FLOATING RESTROOM AS WELL AS COMPLETE AN EXTENSION OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES ON THE DOCK.THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL MAINTAIN CLEAN VESSEL RELATED FACILITIES FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF BOATERS AND KEEP WASTE OUT OF THE WATER FOR THE SAFETY OF THE BOATERS AND AQUATIC WILDLIFE.

THE NORTH CAROLINA DIVISION OF COASTAL MANAGEMENT IS APPLYING FOR FEDERAL ASSISTANCE TO FUND CONTINUATION OF THE NC MARINE SEWAGE PUMPOUT GRANT PROGRAM (NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM) FOR THE NEXT THREE YEARS (OCTOBER 1, 2023 SEPTEMBER 30, 2026). THE GOAL OF THE NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM OVER THE PAST 20 YEARS HAS BEEN TO MAKE PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS READILY AVAILABLE AND SIGNIFICANTLY MORE CONVENIENT FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS AND MARINA OPERATORS. THE DIVISION OF COASTAL MANAGEMENT HAS BEEN COMMITTED TO MAKING PUMPOUT FACILITIES AS COMMON AS OTHER SERVICES, SUCH AS FUEL. SINCE THE PROGRAMS INCEPTION, THE PROPER DISPOSAL OF BOAT SEWAGE IN NC HAS BEEN A  CATCH 22.  RECREATIONAL BOATERS CLAIM THEY ARE FORCED TO TRAVEL BEYOND THE THREE-MILE TERRITORIAL LIMIT TO DISCHARGE THEIR WASTE, OR DISCHARGE ILLEGALLY IN THE SOUNDS BECAUSE PUMPOUT FACILITIES ARE NOT AVAILABLE. MARINA OPERATORS QUESTION THE NEED FOR INSTALLING PUMPOUT STATIONS BECAUSE OF A LACK OF DEMAND BY RECREATIONAL BOATERS. SINCE 1995, THE NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM HAS AWARDED 128 GRANTS FOR THE INSTALLATION OF 114 PUMPOUT FACILITIES BRINGING THE TOTAL AVAILABLE IN THE COASTAL AREA TO 132. THE NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOWARDS INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PUMPOUTS IN AREAS IDENTIFIED AS LACKING THESE FACILITIES WITH THE INSTALLATION OF 5 ADDITIONAL PUMPOUT STATIONS DURING 2020-2023. DUE TO STATE BUDGET CONSTRAINTS, THE NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO RELY ON MATCHING FUNDS FROM PARTICIPATING MARINAS. THE NC DIVISION OF COASTAL MANAGEMENT WILL ALSO CONTINUE TO UTILIZE THE NC CLEAN MARINA PROGRAM AND THE NC CLEAN BOATER PROGRAM TO PROMOTE THE USE OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES AND INCREASE GENERAL KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF MARINE SEWAGE ON THE ENVIRONMENT. FROM THE START OF THE GRANT PROGRAM, THE MAJOR FOCUS HAS BEEN TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS IN THE ALBEMARLE-PAMLICO ESTUARINE SYSTEM. ONE OF THE SUCCESSES OF THE GRANT PROGRAM HAS BEEN THAT OF THE 114 PUMPOUT STATIONS INSTALLED BY THE PUMPOUT PROGRAM, 56 ARE IN THE ALBEMARLE-PAMLICO REGION. IN 2010 HOWEVER, THE NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES (DENR), DIVISION OF WATER QUALITY (DWQ), REQUESTED AND RECEIVED FROM THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) DESIGNATION OF THE NORTH CAROLINA COASTAL WATERS, EXTENDING THREE NAUTICAL MILES (NM) INTO THE ATLANTIC OCEAN ALONG THE ENTIRE LENGTH OF BRUNSWICK, PENDER AND NEW HANOVER COUNTIES, INCLUDING FUTCH CREEK, PAGES CREEK, BRADLEY CREEK, HEWLETTS CREEK, HOWE CREEK, WHISKEY CREEK, SNOWS CUT, AS WELL AS UNNAMED TRIBUTARIES AND ALL UNNAMED TIDAL CREEKS TO THESE WATERS AS A NO DISCHARGE ZONE (NDZ) PURSUANT TO THE CLEAN WATER ACT, SECTION 312(F)(3). WHILE THERE ARE 23 MARINAS WITH PUMPOUT FACILITIES WITHIN THE NO DISCHARGE ZONES, THE DESIGNATION DOES CONSIDER PUMPOUT FACILITIES OUTSIDE THE ZONE TO ASSURE AN ADEQUATE BOATER TO PUMPOUT RATIO. DURING THE 2009 LEGISLATIVE SESSION, THE NC GENERAL ASSEMBLY PASSED THE CLEAN COASTAL WATER AND VESSEL ACT (SL 2009-345 H 1378 RATIFIED WITH AMENDMENTS JULY 2010). THIS ACT ADDRESSES THE DISCHARGE OF SEWAGE FROM VESSELS INTO CERTAIN COASTAL WATERS AND REQUIRES MARINAS WITH A SPECIFIED SLIP CAPACITY TO INSTALL AND MAINTAIN PUMPOUT FACILITIES. WHILE THE NC PUMPOUT PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO FOCUS ITS EFFORTS ON THE NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED ALBEMARLE-PAMLICO REGION, THE INSTALLATION OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN NO DISCHARGE ZONES WILL ALSO BE A PRIMARY FOCUS. OF THE FIVE FACILITIES RECEIVING GRANT MONEY DURING THE 1721-YEAR CYCLE, TWO OF THOSE WERE IN THE NO DISCHARGE ZONE AND TWO IN THE ALBEMARLE-PAMLICO REGION. THE REMAINING WERE IN ADJACENT COUNTIES.

THE CLEAN VESSEL ACT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR THE O M OF A STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITY AND VESSEL ON CANDLEWOOD LAKE AND AN EDUCATION AND OUTREACH PROGRAM.

THE CLEAN VESSEL ACT OF 1992 AND SUBSEQUENT REAUTHORIZATIONS OF THE ACT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION, OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF PUMPOUT FACIILTIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. THE GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION, CONSTRUCTION, AND OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF STATIONARY AND MOBILE PUMPOUT FACILITIES STATEWIDE ALONG THE COASTALINE OF CONNECTICUT AND WITHIN ITS COASTAL TRIBUTARIES AND RIVERS, AND ADMINISTRATION OF AN OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAM.

THE WASHINGTON STATE PARKS BOATING PROGRAM WILL CONSTRUCT NEW PUMPOUT FACILITIES AND OR PUMPOUT BOATS, CONTINUE TO PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING FOR EXISTING PUMPOUT FACILITIES, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE PUMPOUT WASHINGTON OUTREACH AND EDUCATION PROGRAM.

PROVIDE MAINTENANCE ASSISTANCE FUNDING FOR 16 PUMPOUTS, 16 DUMP STATIONS AND 6 FLOATING RESTROOMS AT 22 LOCATIONS. REPLACE ONE PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS AND RETROFIT TWO FLOATING RESTROOMS. PROVIDE COORDINATION, EDUCATION AND ADMINISTRATION.

CALIFORNIA REQUESTS  916,150 IN INLAND CVA FUNDING FROM FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER F23AS00407. THIS FUNDING, COMBINED WITH  305,383 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDING, WILL ALLOW CALIFORNIA TO INSTALL OR REPLACE FOUR ADA-COMPLIANT FLOATING RESTROOMS, INSTALL ONE NEW DUMP STATION, REPLACE ONE PUMPOUT, PROVIDE TWO OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE GRANTS, AND PROMOTE AWARENESS AND OUTREACH TO CALIFORNIA BOATERS THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE MEDIA CAMPAIGN.
V-1-25 CVA 2023 YACHT WORKS PUMP-OUT REPLACEMENT  COASTAL

CALIFORNIA REQUESTS  782,812 IN COASTAL CVA FUNDING FROM FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER F23AS00407. THIS FUNDING, COMBINED WITH STATE AND LOCAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF AT LEAST  260,937, WILL ALLOW CALIFORNIA TO INSTALL EIGHT NEW REPLACEMENT PUMPOUTS, PROVIDE FOR ONE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE GRANT, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO KEEP SEWAGE FROM OUR WATERWAYS. THESE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ARE EXTREMELY IMPORTANT FOR KEEPING CALIFORNIA S WATERS FREE FROM SEWAGE POLLUTANTS.

SIX OKLAHOMA MARINAS WILL HELP TO PREVENT AND ABATE WATER POLLUTANTS FOR THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA BY USING USFWS- WSFR GRANT MONEY TO BUILD PROPER FLOATING RESTROOMS, PURCHASE PUMP-OUT BOATS, UPGRADE PUMP-OUT STATIONS, MODIFY LIFT STATIONS, AND EDUCATE BOATERS REGARDING THE IMPORTANCE OF EFFECTIVE BOAT SEWAGE REMOVAL AND PROPER DISPOSAL.THE SIX MARINAS THAT WILL BE RECEIVING GRANT FUNDING INCLUDE:BARNACLE BILLS MARINA ON TENKILLER LAKEBURNT CABIN MARINA   RESORT ON TENKILLER LAKEKEYSTONE HARBOR MARINA ON KEYSTONE LAKESNAKE CREEK MARINA ON TENKILLER LAKESUNSET COVE MARINA ON FORT COBB LAKELAKE MURRAY MARINA ON LAKE MURRAYSEVERAL MARINAS HAVE ALSO ENDURED WEATHER DAMAGE FROM TORNADOES IN THE PAST FEW YEARS AND NEED TO UPGRADE OR REPLACE PUMP-OUT SYSTEMS, LIFT STATIONS, AND FLOATING RESTROOMS. WITHIN THE PAST YEAR, THE LEVEL OF CUSTOMERS HAS INCREASED, AND THE MARINAS NEED TO PROVIDE EASILY ACCESSIBLE FLOATING RESTROOMS AND PUMP-OUT FACILITIES. WITH THE INCREASE LEVEL OF CUSTOMERS, THIS WILL HELP EDUCATE THE IMPORTANCE OF EFFECTIVE BOAT SEWAGE REMOVAL AND PROPER DISPOSAL. MARINAS WILL BE PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE PUMP-OUTS AND FLOATING RESTROOM FACILITIES. WHEN CONVENIENT FACILITIES ARE NOT AVAILABLE, PEOPLE MAY RESORT TO UTILIZE THE LAKE AS A RESTROOM.
CLEAN VESSEL ACT, PROJECT V-8-1RECREATIONAL VESSEL SEWAGE PUMPOUT FACILITIESMARINE WATERS
CLEAN VESSEL ACT GRANT PROGRAM FOR INLAND WATERS, V-8

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A CLEAN VESSEL ACT PROGRAM IN RHODE ISLAND TO ASSIST PREVENT POLLUTION DISCHARGE FROM BOATS IN RHODE ISLAND WATERS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE   OUTREACH, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND GRANTS TO MARINA OWNERS TO FUND THE INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF MARINE PUMP OUT FACILITIES AND BOATS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A BETTER INFORMED AND PARTICIPATING MARINA COMMUNITY ABOUT PUMPOUT AVAILABILITY AND CLEANER RHODE ISLAND WATERS. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC   IMPROVED WATERS ARE BENEFICIAL TO ALL RHODE ISLANDERS. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE GRANTS TO MARINA OWNERS FOR THE PURPOSE OF MAINTENANCE AND INSTALLATION OF MARINE PUMP OUT FACILITIES AND PUMP OUT BOATS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECREATIONAL VESSELS BY THE PLACEMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES. OUTREACH ACTIVITIES WILL BE CONDUCTED TO INFORM THE PUBLIC OF THE BENEFITS AND LOCATIONS OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES, AND THE COST OF GRANT ADMINISTRATION WILL BE COVERED.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECREATIONAL VESSELS IN COASTAL FLORIDA BY PROVIDING PUMPOUT FACILITIES, OUTREACH, AND ADMINISTRATION.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECREATIONAL VESSELS IN COASTAL ALABAMA BY THE PLACEMENT OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES, OUTREACH, AND ADMINISTARATION.
THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT AWARD IS REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECREATIONAL VESSELS IN INLAND ALABAMA BY THE CONSTRUCTION OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES.

IN 2020, THE PENNSYLVANIA FISH AND BOAT COMMISSION  COMMISSION  REGISTERED 301,236 BOATS. NEARLY 47  OF REGISTERED BOATS EXCEED 16 FEET, THE MAJORITY OF WHICH ARE WITHIN THE 16- TO 26-FOOT LENGTH CATEGORY. USING THE EPA PROVIDED ESTIMATES, MORE THAN 31,600 BOATS IN PENNSYLVANIA HAVE MARINE SANITATION DEVICES.THE COMMISSION SEEKS TO REHABILITATE OR REPLACE TWO CLEAN VESSEL ACT  CVA  PROJECTS ON INLAND WATERS DURING THE FY2022 GRANT ROUND. PENNSYLVANIA HAS SEVERAL INLAND BODIES OF WATER POPULAR FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS, INCLUDING THE DELAWARE RIVER ESTUARY AND THE THREE RIVERS AREA OF PITTSBURGH, AS WELL AS A NUMBER OF OTHER LARGE RIVERS AND LAKES. FUNDING RECIPIENT LOCATIONS ARE UNKNOWN AT THE TIME OF THIS APPLICATION  THESE WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON THE LOCATION OF THE BOATING FACILITY RELATIVE TO SENSITIVE WATERS, DISCHARGES OF SEWAGE, AND THE BOATING ACTIVITY OBSERVED FROM ANNUAL INSPECTIONS.MARINAS WILL APPLY FOR FUNDING THROUGH THE COMMISSION S CVA GRANT PROGRAM. PROJECT PROPOSALS WILL BE EVALUATED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND TECHNICAL SUITABILITY. POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO HISTORICAL, CULTURAL, OR ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES, AND SPECIES OF SPECIAL CONCERN WILL BE ASSESSED, WITH REVIEWS BY THE JURISDICTIONAL AGENCIES DETERMINING THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT. THE COMMISSION AND MARINA OWNER WILL ENTER INTO AN AGREEMENT DETAILING THE COST SHARE TO BE PROVIDED BY THE MARINA, USER FEES TO BE CHARGED, USE RESTRICTIONS, HOURS OF OPERATION, OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS, INFORMATIONAL SIGNAGE TO BE PROVIDED, ACCESSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, AND NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS FOR PROPOSED CHANGES IN USE OR OWNERSHIP.THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT TWO FACILITIES DURING THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD TO PROVIDE AN EASY, VIABLE WAY OF DISPOSING WASTEWATER FROM BOAT HOLDING TANKS ON THE INLAND WATERS OF THE COMMONWEALTH. EFFORTS WILL BE CONCENTRATED TO INSTALL FACILITIES ON THE ALLEGHENY, OHIO, AND MONONGAHELA RIVERS IN SOUTHWESTERN PENNSYLVANIA, THE DELAWARE RIVER ESTUARY IN SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA  WHERE APPROPRIATE, THE COMMISSION WILL PURSUE FACILITIES ON OTHER INLAND WATER BODIES FREQUENTED BY VESSELS LIKELY TO HAVE PORTA-POTTIES OR FIXED SYSTEMS.WORKING WITH COOPERATORS WILL PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY AS A CONCERN FOR ALL BOATERS. IT IS EXPECTED THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE PROPER TREATMENT AND DISPOSAL OF WASTEWATER. IN ADDITION, THESE FACILITIES WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE DISCHARGE LAWS AND MAKE BOATERS AWARE OF THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY. COOPERATION WILL BE STRENGTHENED BETWEEN STATE AGENCIES AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR, WHICH WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF BOATERS WITH EASY ACCESS TO PUMP OUT FACILITIES.LOCATION  STATEWIDE, WITH A CONCENTRATION IN SOUTHWEST AND SOUTHEAST PENNSYLVANIA.TRACS OBJECTIVE  CONSTRUCT TWO FACILITIES BY APRIL 2024.

IN 2020, THE PENNSYLVANIA FISH AND BOAT COMMISSION  COMMISSION  REGISTERED 301,236 BOATS. NEARLY 47  OF REGISTERED BOATS EXCEED 16 FEET, THE MAJORITY OF WHICH ARE WITHIN THE 16- TO 26-FOOT LENGTH CATEGORY. USING THE EPA PROVIDED ESTIMATES, MORE THAN 31,600 BOATS IN PENNSYLVANIA HAVE MARINE SANITATION DEVICES.THE COMMISSION SEEKS TO REHABILITATE OR REPLACE TWO CLEAN VESSEL ACT  CVA  PROJECTS ON COASTAL WATERS DURING THE FY2022 GRANT ROUND. PENNSYLVANIA S COASTAL ZONE CONSISTS OF LAKE ERIE AND THE PRESQUE ISLE BAY AREA OF LAKE ERIE. SIXTY-THREE MILES OF LAKE ERIE SHORELINE IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHWEST CORNER OF PENNSYLVANIA BETWEEN THE OHIO AND NEW YORK STATE LINES. GIVEN THE INCREASE IN RECREATIONAL BOATERS, THE QUALITY OF THE FISHERY, AND THE NUMBER OF SPECIES OF SPECIAL CONCERN IN LAKE ERIE AND PRESQUE ISLE BAY, THE COMMISSION BELIEVES MORE PUMP OUT FACILITIES ARE NEEDED IN THE LAKE ERIE REGION AND PLANS TO CONTINUE WORKING WITH MARINAS AND YACHT CLUBS IN THE LAKE ERIE AND PRESQUE ISLE BAY AREA TO DEVELOP ADDITIONAL FACILITIES. FUNDING RECIPIENT LOCATIONS ARE UNKNOWN AT THE TIME OF THIS APPLICATION  THESE WILL BE SELECTED BASED ON THE LOCATION OF THE BOATING FACILITY RELATIVE TO SENSITIVE WATERS, DISCHARGES OF SEWAGE, AND THE BOATING ACTIVITY OBSERVED FROM ANNUAL INSPECTIONS.MARINAS WILL APPLY FOR FUNDING THROUGH THE COMMISSION S CVA GRANT PROGRAM. PROJECT PROPOSALS WILL BE EVALUATED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND TECHNICAL SUITABILITY. POTENTIAL IMPACTS TO HISTORICAL, CULTURAL, OR ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES, AND SPECIES OF SPECIAL CONCERN WILL BE ASSESSED, WITH REVIEWS BY THE JURISDICTIONAL AGENCIES DETERMINING THE OUTCOME OF THE PROJECT. THE COMMISSION AND MARINA OWNER WILL ENTER INTO AN AGREEMENT DETAILING THE COST SHARE TO BE PROVIDED BY THE MARINA, USER FEES TO BE CHARGED, USE RESTRICTIONS, HOURS OF OPERATION, OPERATING INSTRUCTIONS, INFORMATIONAL SIGNAGE TO BE PROVIDED, ACCESSIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, AND NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENTS FOR PROPOSED CHANGES IN USE OR OWNERSHIP.THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT TWO FACILITIES DURING THE PERFORMANCE PERIOD TO PROVIDE AN EASY, VIABLE WAY OF DISPOSING WASTEWATER FROM BOAT HOLDING TANKS ON THE COASTAL WATERS OF THE COMMONWEALTH. EFFORTS WILL BE FOCUSED TO INSTALL FACILITIES IN THE LAKE ERIE AND PRESQUE ISLE BAY AREA.WORKING WITH COOPERATORS WILL PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY AS A CONCERN FOR ALL BOATERS. IT IS EXPECTED THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGH THE PROPER TREATMENT AND DISPOSAL OF WASTEWATER. IN ADDITION, THESE FACILITIES WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE DISCHARGE LAWS AND MAKE BOATERS AWARE OF THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL RESPONSIBILITY. COOPERATION WILL BE STRENGTHENED BETWEEN STATE AGENCIES AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR, WHICH WILL LEAD TO AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF BOATERS WITH EASY ACCESS TO PUMP OUT FACILITIES.LOCATION  LAKE ERIE AND THE PRESQUE ISLE BAY AREA OF PENNSYLVANIA.TRACS OBJECTIVE  CONSTRUCT TWO FACILITIES BY APRIL 2024.
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECRATIONAL VESSELS BY PROVIDING PUMPOUT FACILITIES, OUTREACH AND ADMINISTRATION.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO REDUCE SEWAGE DISCHARGE FROM RECREATIONAL VESSELS IN THE COSTAL WATERS OF SOUTH CAROLINA. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY PROVIDING PUMPOUT FACILITIES TO RECREATIONAL BOATERS, OUTREACH REGARDING THE CVA PROGRAM, AND GRANT ADMINISTRATION.

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES CLEAN VESSEL ACT GRANT PROGRAM APPLICATION FOR PUMPOUT PROJECTS, PARTNERSHIP, AND OUTREACH

PROVIDE MAINTENANCE ASSISTANCE FUNDING FOR 17 PUMPOUTS, 21 DUMP STATIONS AND 15 FLOATING RESTROOMS AT 35 LOCATIONS  REPLACE ONE PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS AND RETROFIT THREE FLOATING RESTROOMS  PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND OUTREACH EDUCATION

CALIFORNIA REQUESTS  920,624 IN COASTAL CVA FUNDING FROM FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER F22AS00019  THIS FUNDING,COMBINED WITH STATE AND LOCAL CONTRIBUTIONS OF AT LEAST  306,875, WILL ALLOW CALIFORNIA TO INSTALL NINE NEW REPLACEMENT PUMPOUTS, PROVIDE ONE OPERATION AND  MAINTENANCE GRANT, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO KEEPSEWAGE FROM OUR WATERWAYS  THESE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ARE EXTREMELY IMPORTANT TO KEEPING CALIFORNIA S WATERS FREEFROM SEWAGE POLLUTANTS THE PROPOSAL PRESENTED HEREIN IS DESIGNED TO CONTINUE THE WORK OUTLINED IN THE CALIFORNIA STATEWIDE VESSEL WASTEDISPOSAL PLAN  VWDP  ORIGINALLY APPROVED IN MARCH 1994, UPDATED IN 2002, AND JUST REVISED IN 2020 EFFORTS WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE THE NUMBER AND OR AVAILABILITY OF SEWAGE PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS LOCATED INBOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE BOATING FACILITIES AND TO ACTIVELY EDUCATE TARGETED AUDIENCES ABOUT THE PROBLEMSASSOCIATED WITH VESSEL SEWAGE WATERWAY DISCHARGE  IN ADDITION, EFFORTS WILL CONTINUE WITH STUDIES TO IDENTIFY THEVOLUME OF SEWAGE THAT IS KEPT FROM REACHING THE COASTAL WATERWAYS BY THESE CVA FUNDED PREVENTIVE MEASURES AS WELLAS IMPLEMENTING ADDITIONAL PREVENTIVE MEASURES TO POSITIVELY INFLUENCE NON MOTORIZED BOATER SEWAGE HABITS ANDBEHAVIOR IT IS EXPECTED THAT THIS CVA GRANT AWARD WILL HELP CALIFORNIA PROVIDE ADEQUATE SEWAGE COLLECTION EQUIPMENT TOMEET BOATER DEMAND AND THUS PREVENT DISCHARGE OF SEWAGE INTO CALIFORNIA WATERWAYS THE PROPOSED EDUCATION PROGRAM WILL REACH MILLIONS OF RECREATIONAL BOATERS IN CALIFORNIA TO EDUCATE THEM ABOUTWHY IT IS SO IMPORTANT TO NOT DISCHARGE SEWAGE INTO CALIFORNIA S WATERWAYS  EDUCATE THEM ON WAYS TO PREVENTUNWANTED SEWAGE DISCHARGES  AND, TO INFORM THEM OF FACILITIES AVAILABLE TO MEET THEIR WASTE DISPOSAL NEEDS  THESEEFFORTS ARE EXPECTED TO AFFECT POSITIVE BEHAVIORAL CHANGES

CALIFORNIA REQUESTS  1,086,750 IN INLAND CVA FUNDING FROM FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER F22AS00019  THIS FUNDING,COMBINED WITH  362,250 IN STATE AND LOCAL FUNDING, WILL ALLOW CALIFORNIA TO INSTALL OR REPLACE SIX ADA COMPLIANTFLOATING RESTROOMS, INSTALL ONE NEW DUMP STATION, REPLACE ONE PUMPOUT, PROVIDE TWO OPERATION AND MAINTENANCEGRANTS, AND PROMOTE AWARENESS AND OUTREACH TO CALIFORNIA BOATERS THROUGH A COMPREHENSIVE MEDIA CAMPAIGN CALIFORNIA PROPOSES TO INCREASE THE NUMBER AND OR AVAILABILITY OF SEWAGE PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATIONS LOCATED INBOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE BOATING FACILITIES, MAINTAIN OR INCREASE THE NUMBER OF FLOATING RESTROOMS, AND ACTIVELYEDUCATE TARGET AUDIENCES ABOUT THE PROBLEMS ASSOCIATED WITH VESSEL WASTE AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FACILITIES TOMEET BOATER WASTE DISPOSAL NEEDS THIS PROPOSAL WILL RESULT IN NEW FACILITIES TO HELP MEET THE DEMAND FOR BOATER GENERATED SEWAGE COLLECTION,PREVENT THE DISCHARGE OF SEWAGE INTO CALIFORNIA WATERWAYS, AND IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF CALIFORNIA S INLAND WATERS IN ADDITION, THE PROPOSED EDUCATION PROGRAM WILL REACH OUT TO THE MILLIONS OF RECREATIONAL BOATERS IN CALIFORNIATO EDUCATE AND REMIND THEM WHY IT IS SO IMPORTANT TO NOT DISCHARGE SEWAGE INTO CALIFORNIA S WATERWAYS AND  KEEPOUR WATER CLEAN  PAGE 21

?THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FOR CVA GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS FOR FY 2022 IS TO CONTINUE OUR EFFORT TO CREATE COMPREHENSIVE AVAILABILITY OF PUMPOUT AND RELATED FACILITIES TO BOATERS USING CONNECTICUT COASTAL WATERS. SPECIFICALLY, OUR ACTIONS ARE TO IDENTIFY NECESSARY PROJECTS (PUMPOUT BOAT, OFFLOADING STATION, DUMP STATIONS), TO PRIORITIZE PROJECTS, REVIEW ELIGIBILITY OF PROPOSED PROJECTS, TO PROVIDE A PUMPOUT BOAT SERVICE TO BOATERS ON CANDLEWOOD LAKE, TO EDUCATE AND INFORM MEMBERS OF THE BOATING PUBLIC OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF VESSEL SEWAGE DISCHARGES, THE AVAILABILITY OF PUMPOUT AND WASTE RECEPTION FACILITIES, AND THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES TO COMPLY WITH DISCHARGE LAWS, AND TO MONITOR THE NEED FOR PUMPOUT FACILITIES FOLLOWING IMPLEMENTATION. EXPECTED BENEFITS INCLUDE THE REDUCTION OF BOAT SEWAGE WASTE IN LONG ISLAND SOUND, EDUCATION OF BOATERS ABOUT THE BENEFITS OF APPROPRIATELY USING PUMPOUTS, AND LOCATIONS FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS TO DISPOSE OF WASTE RESPONSIBLY.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT FOR CVA GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS FOR FY 2022 IS TO CONTINUE OUR EFFORT TO CREATE COMPREHENSIVE AVAILABILITY OF PUMPOUT AND RELATED FACILITIES TO BOATERS USING CANDLEWOOD LAKE. SPECIFICALLY, OUR ACTIONS ARE TO IDENTIFY NECESSARY PROJECTS (PUMPOUT BOAT, OFFLOADING STATION, DUMP STATIONS), TO PRIORITIZE PROJECTS, REVIEW ELIGIBILITY OF PROPOSED PROJECTS, TO PROVIDE A PUMPOUT BOAT SERVICE TO BOATERS ON CANDLEWOOD LAKE, TO EDUCATE AND INFORM MEMBERS OF THE BOATING PUBLIC OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS OF VESSEL SEWAGE DISCHARGES, THE AVAILABILITY OF PUMPOUT AND WASTE RECEPTION FACILITIES, AND THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES TO COMPLY WITH DISCHARGE LAWS, AND TO MONITOR THE NEED FOR PUMPOUT FACILITIES FOLLOWING IMPLEMENTATION. EXPECTED BENEFITS INCLUDE THE REDUCTION OF BOAT SEWAGE WASTE IN CANDLEWOOD LAKE AND LOCATIONS FOR RECREATIONAL BOATERS TO DISPOSE OF WASTE RESPONSIBLY.

THE DIVISION OF MARINE FISHERIES' (MA DMF) OBJECTIVES ARE TO EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY ADMINISTER THE CVA PROGRAM IN MASSACHUSETTS IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT ADEQUATE AND REASONABLY AVAILABLE PUMPOUT FACILITIES MEET THE NEEDS OF THE RECREATIONAL VESSELS USING MASSACHUSETTS STATE WATERS. OUR PROGRAM AIMS TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE AVAILABILITY OF NO-COST PUMPOUT SERVICES THROUGH NEW, AND REPLACEMENT, INFRASTRUCTURE AND THROUGH PROVIDING FUNDS TO OPERATORS FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE COSTS. WE SEEK TO EDUCATE AND INFORM BOAT OWNERS, OPERATORS, AND RETAILERS; MARINA OWNERS AND OPERATORS; SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT OWNERS AND OPERATORS; FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AUTHORITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS; THE ENVIRONMENTAL COMMUNITY; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC ABOUT THE CLEAN VESSEL ACT AND THE MANY BENEFITS TO PARTICIPATING IN THE CVA PROGRAM.

NEW YORK DEC'S PUMPOUT PROGRAM INCLUDESACONSTRUCTION/UPGRADE PROGRAM, WHICH PROVIDES FUNDING TO INSTALL, REPLACE, UPGRADE, AND REPAIR PUMPOUT FACILITIES THAT RECEIVE SEWAGE FROM RECREATIONAL MARINE VESSELS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FOR UP TO 75% OF ELIGIBLE PROJECT COSTS WITH A MAXIMUM AWARD OF $35,000 FOR A LAND-BASED UNIT. INLAND ZONE WATERS ANTICIPATE A NEED FOR 3 NEW UNITS AND 5 UPGRADES OR REPAIRS. THE INFORMATION & EDUCATION PROGRAM PROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE THE USE OF OR PROVIDE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT PUMPOUT STATIONS IN LOCAL AREAS.THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM PROVIDES ASSISTANCE FOR THE ANNUAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE COSTS OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES. THIS HELPS ENSURE THAT THE STATE'S 70 EXISTING PUMPOUTS FACILITIES REMAIN FUNCTIONAL AND PROVIDE THE LEVEL OF SERVICE NEEDED TO ACCOMMODATE RECREATIONAL BOATERS. EFC EXPECTS PUMPOUTS WILL NEED TO BE UPGRADED OR REPAIRED EACH YEAR BECAUSE EQUIPMENT HAS BEEN DAMAGED OR WORN THROUGH NORMAL USE, IS INADEQUATE FOR THE NEEDS OF A GROWING MARINA OR HAS REACHED THE END OF ITS USEFUL LIFE. IN ADDITION, NEW YORK HAS SUFFERED MAJOR STORMS IN THE PAST COUPLE OF YEARS RESULTING IN AN INCREASED NEED FOR THIS PROGRAM.

THE STATE'S CVAP PROVIDES THREE TYPES OF GRANTS TO GOVERNMENTAL AND PRIVATE APPLICANTS:1) CONSTRUCTION/UPGRADE PROGRAM - THE CONSTRUCTION GRANT PROGRAM PROVIDESFUNDING TO INSTALL, REPLACE, UPGRADE, AND REPAIR PUMPOUT FACILITIES THAT RECEIVESEWAGE FROM RECREATIONAL MARINE VESSELS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FOR UP TO 75%OFELIGIBLE PROJECT COSTS. 2) INFORMATION & EDUCATION - THE INFORMATION & EDUCATION ("I & E") GRANT PROGRAMPROVIDES FUNDING FOR PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE THE USE OF OR PROVIDE KNOWLEDGEABOUT PUMPOUT FACILITIES IN LOCAL AREAS. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FOR UP TO 75% OFELIGIBLE PROJECT COSTS.3) OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM - THE OPERATIONS AND MAINTENANCE GRANTPROGRAM ("O&M") PROVIDES ASSISTANCE FOR THE ANNUAL OPERATION AND MAINTENANCECOSTS OF PUMPOUT FACILITIES. GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FOR UP TO 75% OF ELIGIBLE COSTS.EFC ESTIMATES THAT THE REMAINING DEMAND FOR NEW AND UPGRADED PUMPOUTFACILITIES IN THE STATE IS AS FOLLOWS:COASTAL ZONE WATERS: PUMPOUTS - 8 NEW UNITS AND 6 UPGRADES OR REPAIRS. COAST ZONE WATERS: 3 NEW PUMPOUT BOATS

THE FUNDS OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE NECESSARY TO PROVIDE GRANTS TO STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITIES (FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE, REPAIR, AND THE INSTALLATION OF NEW FACILITIES), AND TO CONTINUE AN OUTREACH PROGRAM TO EDUCATE THE BOATING COMMUNITY ON BOAT DISCHARGE REGULATIONS.NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) PROPOSES TO:- PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO DEFRAY COST OF EXISTING FACILITIES TO THREE MARINAS FOR ANNUAL ROUTINE COSTS IN 2022. FUND A PORTION OF SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR 1-2 STAFF PEOPLE TO OVERSEE GRANT AGREEMENT DEVELOPMENT FOR PUMPOUT AND DUMP STATION FACILITIES, TO PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT, TO SUPERVISE CONTRACTORS, MANAGE EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH AND ADVERTISEMENTS, AND TO WORK DIRECTLY WITH MARINA STAFF, BOATING GROUPS, AND THE PUBLIC, TO FUND 1 ADVERTISEMENT IN A POPULAR BOATING MAGAZINE, AND TO COMMUNICATE WITH 12 MARINA MANAGERS/OWNERS TO INFORM THEM OF FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES AND OBTAIN UPDATED MARINA INFORMATION.

THE FUNDS OUTLINED IN THIS PROPOSAL ARE NECESSARY TO OPERATE MOBILE PUMPOUT BOAT SERVICE,PROVIDE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE REIMBURSEMENT TO STATIONARY FACILITIES, AND INCREASE PUBLICAWARENESS OF THE COASTAL REGULATIONS REGARDING SEWAGE DISCHARGE THROUGH AN OUTREACH PROGRAM.WITHOUT THIS FUNDING, POLLUTION FROM BOAT DISCHARGE MAY CAUSE SHELLFISH CLOSURES, RESTRICTED ORREDUCED FISHING OPPORTUNITIES, BEACH ADVISORIES, ANOXIC ZONES, AND WATER QUALITY DEGRADATION. NEW HAMPSHIRE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES (NHDES) PROPOSES TO: PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO 1 STATIONARY PUMPOUT FACILITY FOR THE2022 BOATING SEASON, PROVIDE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE FUNDING TO SUPPORT 1 MOBILE PUMPOUT BOAT FOR THE2022 BOATING SEASON, FUND A PORTION OF SALARY AND BENEFITS FOR 1-2 STAFF PEOPLE TO MAINTAIN CURRENT RESOURCEMATERIALS, OVERSEE SUB-GRANTS FOR PUMPOUT SERVICES, PREPARE THE NECESSARY FEDERALREPORTS, AND CONTINUE PUBLIC OUTREACH EFFORTS, AND PROVIDE FUNDS FOR CVA SIGNS, PUBLICATIONS, AND OTHER OUTREACH MATERIALS AS NEEDED.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AWARD IS TO PROVIDE PUMPOUT STATIONS AND WASTE RECEPTION FACILITIES TO SAFELY DISPOSE OF RECREATIONAL BOATER SEWAGE.THIS GRANT WILL BE FOR THE CONSTRUCTION/PURCHASE OF ONE NEW SEWAGE PUMPOUT BOAT, A REBUILD PUMP KIT, A NEW STATIONARY SEWAGE PUMPOUT, AND MAINTENANCE OF EXISTING PUMPOUTS. THESE PROJECTS WILL OCCUR AT LAKE CUMBERLAND AND DALE HOLLOW LAKE IN KENTUCKY (WISDOM DOCK MARINA IS LOCATED ON DALE HOLLOW).

SEVEN OKLAHOMA MARINAS WILL HELP TO PREVENT AND ABATE WATER POLLUTANTS FOR THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA BY USING USFWS- WSFR GRANT MONEY TO BUILD PROPER FLOATING RESTROOMS, PURCHASE PUMP-OUT BOATS, UPGRADE PUMP-OUT STATIONS, MODIFY LIFT STATIONS, AND EDUCATE BOATERS REGARDING THE IMPORTANCE OF EFFECTIVE BOAT SEWAGE REMOVAL AND PROPER DISPOSAL.THE SEVEN MARINAS THAT WILL BE RECEIVING GRANT FUNDING INCLUDE:BEAVERS BEND MARINA ON BROKEN BOW LAKE BLUEWATER BAY MARINA ON LAKE TENKILLER LITTLE RIVER MARINA ON LAKE THUNDERBIRDSAFE HARBOR HARBORS VIEW MARINA ON GRAND LAKE O'THE CHEROKEES SCISSORTAIL MARINA ON GRAND LAKE O'THE CHEROKEESSTRAYHORN MARINA ON TENKILLER FERRY LAKE XTREME COVE MARINA ON LAKE EUFAULAWITHIN THE PAST YEAR, THE LEVEL OF CUSTOMERS HAS INCREASED, AND THE MARINAS NEED TO PROVIDE EASILY ACCESSIBLE FLOATING RESTROOMS AND PUMP-OUT FACILITIES. WITH THE INCREASE LEVEL OF CUSTOMERS, THIS WILL HELP EDUCATE THE IMPORTANCE OF EFFECTIVE BOAT SEWAGE REMOVAL AND PROPER DISPOSAL. MARINAS WILL BE PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SAFE PUMP-OUTS AND FLOATING RESTROOM FACILITIES. WHEN CONVENIENT FACILITIES ARE NOT AVAILABLE, PEOPLE MAY RESORT TO UTILIZE THE LAKE AS A RESTROOM.

WHITTIER IS LOCATED ON THE WESTERN SIDE OF PRINCE WILLIAM SOUND (PWS), ABOUT 50 MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE CITY OF ANCHORAGE. WHITTIER HARBOR IS A FULL-SERVICE, ICE-FREE PORT, WHICH IS OPEN YEAR-ROUND WITH 360 SLIPS FOR BOTHTRANSIENT AND PERMANENT BERTH HOLDERS. THIS IS THE ONLY NATURAL ICE-FREE, DEEP-WATER PORT IN SOUTHCENTRAL ALASKA AND THE CLOSEST TO ANCHORAGE, THE LARGEST CITY IN ALASKA. WHITTIER PROVIDES THE CLOSEST ACCESS TO PWS,WHICH CONTAINS CHUGACH NATIONAL FOREST AND A VARIETY OF STATE MARINE PARKS, PUBLIC USE RECREATIONAL CABINS, AND A VARIETY OF SPORT ANGLING AND OTHER RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES. PWS IS A PRIMARY RECREATIONAL BOATING AND SPORT-ANGLING DESTINATION OF THE RESIDENTS OF ANCHORAGE, MATANUSKA/SUSITNA (MAT-SU) VALLEY, AND THE KENAI PENINSULA CITIES OF SEWARD, SOLDOTNA, KENAI, AND HOMER.PERMANENT MOORAGE SLIPS ARE FULLY BOOKED, AND THE HARBOR MASTER MAINTAINS A WAITLIST FOR THOSE LOOKING FOR A PERMANENT SLIP, WHICH CAN TAKE UP TO 10 YEARS TO GET. THE HARBOR ALSO OPERATES AN EXTREMELY BUSY BOAT RAMP TO SERVE TRAILERABLE BOATS FROM ANCHORAGE, THE MAT-SU VALLEY, AND THE KENAI PENINSULA. ALL THIS BOAT TRAFFIC CAUSES A POTENTIAL FOR THE WATERS OF THE HARBOR AND PWS TO BECOME POLLUTED WITH MISMANAGED SEWAGE FROM BOATERS. FOR THIS REASON, IT IS CRITICAL FOR THE HARBOR TO HAVE PROPER FACILITIES TO DEAL WITH ONBOARD SEWAGE.THE EXISTING PUMPOUT CART AT THE WHITTER HARBOR NO LONGER FUNCTIONS PROPERLY AND DUE TO AGE AND IS NO LONGER SERVICEABLE.THE NEXT NEAREST PUBLIC PUMPOUT IS IN VALDEZ, 90 MILES TO THE EAST, AND IS NOT AN OPTION FOR MOST BOATERS USING THE WHITTIER HARBOR. A NEW PUMPOUT CART IS NEEDED IN WHITTIER TO SERVE THE RECREATIONAL BOATERSAND REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF SEWAGE DUMPED AT SEA.
THE PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO INSTALL A SEWER PUMPOUT FACILITY FOR THE NEW MULTI-USE DOCK, AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO HELP KEEP WATERS CLEAN THROUGH PROVIDING FUNDING THROUGHTHE CLEAN VESSEL ACT. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP MAINTAIN AND RENOVATE EXISTING PUMPOUTFACILITIES AT APACHE LAKE, KATHERINE LANDING AT LAKE MOHAVE, ANTELOPE POINT MARINA ATLAKE POWELL, AND SCORPION BAY MARINA AT LAKE PLEASANT AS WELL AS PROVIDING FUNDING TOPURCHASE A FLOATING RESTROOM FOR APACHE LAKE. ALL OF THESE PROJECTS WILL BE COMPLETEDTHROUGH SUB-GRANTEES. THE BENEFITS OF THESE PROJECTS WILL PROVIDE BOATERS WITH CLEAN,EFFICIENT FACILITIES TO PREVENT WASTE DISPOSAL INTO PUBLIC WATERWAYS AND THEIR ECOSYSTEMS.

THE CITY OF SANDPOINT HAS AN IMMEDIATE NEED TO REPLACE THE EXISTING PUMP-OUT STATION LOCATED AT CITY BEACH PARK PUBLIC MARINA(48.2722554, -116.5426487) AND SERVING RECREATIONAL BOATERS OPERATING ON LAKE PEND OREILLE. THE EXISTING DIAPHRAGM PUMP OUT STATION IS OVER 20 YEARS OLD AND HAS SERVED THOUSANDS OF BOATERS SINCE IT WAS ORIGINALLY INSTALLED. IN 2021 THE CURRENT STATION BROKE DOWN NUMEROUS TIMES AND IS CURRENTLY ON THE VERGE OF NO REPAIR. THE PUMP-STATION LOCATED AT CITY BEACH IS THE ONLY PUBLICLY AVAILABLE PUMP STATION THAT IS ACCESSIBLE BY LARGE VESSELS AT THIS END OF THE 43-MILE LONG LAKE. PUMP-OUT STATIONS ARE CRITICAL TO THE HEALTH, SAFETY AND WELLNESS OF THE COMMUNITY AND ENVIRONMENT.

FUNDS ARE TO BE USED TO RENOVATE TWO CVA PUMP-OUT FACILITIES AT THE KATHERINE LANDING MARINA AND SCORPION BAY MARINA; AND PURCHASE A PUMP-OUT BOAT AT THE SCORPION BAY MARINA.

OK V-20-D-1  CVA PUMP-OUTS

FUNDS WILL BE USED TO INSTALL FIVE CVA PUMP-OUT FACILITIES AT THE ARROWHEAD YACHT CLUB & MARINA, EUFAULA COVE MARINA, NEWBERRY CREEK RESORT & MARINA, REDBUD MARINA & RV PARK, AND EVERGREEN MARINA; AND PURCHASE A PUMP-OUT BOAT AT THE EVERGREEN MARINA.
